intro: Barleria elata, commonly known as red balm or red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually bright red or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine layer of white, silky hairs. Barleria elata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
